thread.title: EastEnders spoilers: A family lies in pieces after shocking events that change them forever
thread.title_full: EastEnders spoilers: A family lies in pieces after shocking events that change them forever

author: Duncan Lindsay
title: EastEnders spoilers: A family lies in pieces after shocking events that change them forever
text:
(Picture: BBC) Life is about to change forever for an EastEnders family as they are brutally ripped apart by unexpected events this week. And, in the aftermath of the huge drama, they try their best to pick up the pieces of their shattered world. 
But as the severity of the bleak situation hits home, can the damaged clan hold it together – or is this one agony too far?
We are currently sworn to secrecy over the shocking turn of events that leaves a family ripped to pieces – or even which characters are involved – as we don’t want the surprise to be ruined for viewers on screen.

However, in the week that follows, there are a few hints that we can just about part with for now – the episodes are certainly dramatic and worth tuning into as the dust settles on the life changing events.
Monday 3rd April (Picture: BBC) The residents struggle to return to normal after shocking events – one family has been ripped to pieces while another continues to drift apart but can the rifts be healed? Gossip spreads about everything that has happened and Martin struggles to get his head around recent incidents.
Tuesday 4th April (Picture: BBC) As alarm bells ring for one resident, the severity of a daunting situation hits home for another. Tina visits Shirley in prison and Abi tries to help Jay and Ben find a new flatmate. Josh invites Lauren for dinner to talk about a job at Max’s company.
Thursday 6th April (Picture: BBC) Bex continues to reel from recent events while Tina receives a helping hand from an unexpected friend. Max tries to talk Lauren out of applying to join his company.
Friday 7th April Tina prepares for Shirley’s return home while it’s the day of the sponsored bike ride to raise money for the community fayre. Will everything go to plan?
